snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency overstepped its powers by setting water quality criteria for coal mining operations in Appalachia, a federal judge ruled Tuesday.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Reggie B Walton rules the Environmental Protection Agency overstepped its powers by setting water quality criteria for coal mining operations in Appalachia.
lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency overstepped its powers by setting water quality criteria for coal mining operations in Appalachia, a federal judge ruled Tuesday.
